headline.main: WILLKIE PLEASED BY HOUSE ACTION; He Attributes Close Vote Partly to 'Administration's Negll- gence' on Labor Problems

lead_paragraph: Declaring yesterday that the adoption of the amendments to the Neutrality Act by the House was "gratifying," Wendell L. Willkie attributed the close vote in part to "the Administration's negligence and muddling in the solution of our industrial labor relations problem" and "its utter disregard of the needs and rights of large elements of our population in the handling of our domestic and defense program."
abstract: Willkie attributes Neutrality Act close vote to Adm's muddling in labor disputes

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: NAZI, ANTI-, LEAGUE TO CHAMPION HUMAN RIGHTS, NON-SECTARIAN
